info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 25 at 3:23PM EDT until March 25 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT FOR EASTERN MERCER...NORTHWESTERN VENANGO...NORTHEASTERN LAWRENCE AND NORTHWESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES... At 322 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Guys Mills, or 8 miles east of Meadville, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...911 Call Center. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Grove City, Franklin, Sugarcreek, Stoneboro, Harrisville, Polk, Sandy Lake, Cooperstown, Jackson Center, Barkeyville, Utica, and New Lebanon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
